entry.title: Gravity
entry.summary:
Author: Astrea_Stars

Summary: Hal reached the slightly open door to Bruce’s bedroom and pushed it open without thinking.And immediately regretted everything.Because Bruce was—Oh.Oh, shit.Bruce was curled up on his side, half-naked, wrapped around a blanket like it was the only thing keeping him together.He wasn’t fully under the covers—just sprawled across the mattress, one arm tucked under his head, the other gripping the blanket like it was a lifeline. His muscles were still flexed, even in sleep, every line of his body carved and powerful. His broad chest, the sharp curve of his abs, the long stretch of his legs—Hal’s brain short-circuited.Because it should’ve been impossible for a man this big, this built, to look so adorable.(Just want to let you know that reading the smut is completely optional, it doesn't affect the story if you don't want to read it)

entry.title: Alright for now
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Summary: “Enjoy your nap?” Bruce asked casually. Hal didn’t bother to pull his shirt down leaving a sliver of tanned skin for the eye and Bruce was becoming increasingly distracted.“About as good as it can be with a butternut squash kicking the shit out of you.” He mumbled through another yawn.Or a day in the life of Bruce and Hal coexisting while they await the arrival of their one-night-surprise baby.

entry.title: Sometimes Owls are better hunters than Bats
entry.summary:
Author: TheCuriousCat

Summary: Bruce Wayne had never thought of himself as a family man. He used to laugh as people around him settled down, falling into a single bed and swearing to stay there.Then again he'd never thought he'd be ripped across time and space to this cesspool of a city either, forced to watch this world's idiot version of himself run around in a fucking bat costume of all things. The 'having kids' aspect grows on him after interacting with them, the ones pulled here not the originals [those guys were idiots too]. They are smart, pretty pissed with the state of this place too, and curious enough at the prospect of family that they were willing to give it a go.Bruce still doesn't think this labels him as a family man... until he meets this world's Hal, she's oddly perfect. Able to mesh herself into his newly mashed-together family without any friction. He doesn't believe in love at first sight but he's pretty sure this is what it would feel like, all-consuming and violently possessive.He's going to keep this, he decides, the beautiful and loving wife, the competent children he'd be happy giving his wealth to if he died. And it all starts with slaughtering the speedsters so they can't send him back home.
